method.name: Unification Discretizer

reference.ref: R. Jin, Y. Breitbart, C. Muoh. Data discretization uni?cation. Knowledge and Information Systems 19 (2009) 1-29.

generalDescription.objective: To transform a set of numerical variables into nominal variables. Input variables may be either real or integer.
generalDescription.howWork:
Unification Discretizer is an algorithm that discretizes the non nominal attributes (real or integer) of a group of instances.
The task of a discretization algorithm is to build a set of intervals for each non nominal attribute. The value of the attribute is translated to the interval number to which the value belongs.
Unification Discretizer is a method for supervised discretization. The method is a dynamic programming method that tries to explore every possibility and chooses the best discretization according to some parameters.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Unification Discretizer Dataset: Iris Plants
Input Training set: iris-10-1tra.dat Input Test set: iris-10-1tst.dat Output Training set: Unification-D.iris-10-1tra.dat Output Test set: Unification-D.iris-10-1tst.dat Descriptor: result1e0.txt
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/Unification-D.iris folder the discretization results; 3 files are generated in this folder:
File Unification-D.iris-10-1tra.dat: It contains the discretization result of training set.
@relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2,3,4,5} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,1,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 2,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa ... 4,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor 4,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor 4,2,2,2,Iris-versicolor 2,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 4,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 1,1,1,2,Iris-versicolor 1,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 3,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor 3,0,1,1,Iris-versicolor 3,1,1,2,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 4,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor 2,2,1,2,Iris-versicolor ... 5,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,3,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,2,2,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,1,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 4,1,2,3,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,3,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,2,3,3,Iris-virginica
File Unification-D.iris-10-1tst.dat: It contains the discretization result of testing set.
@relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2,3,4,5} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 3,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 1,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 4,1,1,2,Iris-versicolor 4,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 4,1,2,2,Iris-versicolor 3,1,1,2,Iris-versicolor 3,3,1,2,Iris-versicolor 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 5,1,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,0,2,2,Iris-virginica 4,2,3,3,Iris-virginica 3,1,2,3,Iris-virginica
File result1e0.txt: It contains the descriptor of cutting points used in the discretization.
Cut point 0 of attribute 0 : 4.85 Cut point 1 of attribute 0 : 5.45 Cut point 2 of attribute 0 : 5.75 Cut point 3 of attribute 0 : 6.25 Cut point 4 of attribute 0 : 7.05 Number of cut points of attribute 0 : 5 Cut point 0 of attribute 1 : 2.45 Cut point 1 of attribute 1 : 2.95 Cut point 2 of attribute 1 : 3.3499999999999996 Number of cut points of attribute 1 : 3 Cut point 0 of attribute 2 : 2.45 Cut point 1 of attribute 2 : 4.75 Cut point 2 of attribute 2 : 5.05 Number of cut points of attribute 2 : 3 Cut point 0 of attribute 3 : 0.75 Cut point 1 of attribute 3 : 1.35 Cut point 2 of attribute 3 : 1.75 Number of cut points of attribute 3 : 3
